cz.cuni.mff.kocur.streaming

Interface Source

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BasicSource, InfluenceSource, WorldSource

    public interface Source

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void flow(InformationDrop d)
      Flows the information from this source to the sink.
      int getSourceId()
      Should return unique identification of this source.
      java.lang.String getSourceName()
      Source name might not be unique and should be used as string that can be read by user, so that he knows what is this source streaming etc.
      void setSourceId(int id)
      Sets source id.
      void startFlowing()
      Starts the information flow.
      void stopFlowing()
      Stops the information flow.
      void wasted()
      If the stream source should be wasted.

    • Method Detail

      • flow

        void flow(InformationDrop d)
        Flows the information from this source to the sink.

      • wasted

        void wasted()
        If the stream source should be wasted.

      • getSourceId

        int getSourceId()
        Should return unique identification of this source. So that sink knows where the data come from.
        Returns:
        Returns unique id that should be registered under the Sink.

      • setSourceId

        void setSourceId(int id)
        Sets source id. This should be unique number.

      • getSourceName

        java.lang.String getSourceName()
        Source name might not be unique and should be used as string that can be read by user, so that he knows what is this source streaming etc.
        Returns:
        Returns string representing this source's name.

      • startFlowing

        void startFlowing()
        Starts the information flow.

      • stopFlowing

        void stopFlowing()
        Stops the information flow.
        This is so that some flowing doesn't come to waste.
